Half-Life: Source
Standalone Edition

This is the standalone version of Half-Life: Source released by DigitalZone.

Half-Life: Source is a digitally remastered version of the critically acclaimed and best selling PC game, enhanced via Source technology to include physics simulation, enhanced effects, and more.

Half-Life: Source is the very same game but imported into Half-Life 2's Source engine. It won't be seeing as much of an extensive overhaul as Counter-Strike has. It will be more of a direct port so the level geometry, textures, sounds and models will remain wholly unchanged from the original, however, all of these old graphics will benefit greatly from all of the latest features in the Source engine including some shader effects (such as realistic water), dynamic lighting and shadow effects and full use of the Havok physics engine and rag-doll physics. 

Just imagine that classic Half-Life game play and engrossing storyline, but every time you throw a hand grenade at a grunt, instead of him acting out a generic death animation (and probably clipping through the wall), he hurtles through the air realistically and bounces to the ground, or shooting the crossbow at a grunt and watch him be impaled on the nearest wall. It may not be all that different from the original Half-Life, but it's sure going to be fun...
